intro: Eurya humboldtiana, commonly known as the Humboldt eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. The leaves are leathery and glossy, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
